result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin J. Altieri was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts - Child Act as Actor/Close Age of Actor and Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court
Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim.  Defendant shall pay restitution to the victim.  Restitution shall be paid while on probation in Count 1.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement and on motion of the State, the court granted a deferred entry of judgment for a period of two years.  Upon successful completion of the agreement, the State will move to dismiss the felony charge.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant must obtain GED/HSED at discretion of agent.
Defendant must undergo a Psychosexual evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall have no contact with S.R.P.-dob: 7-22-02.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample.  Defendant shall comply with the sex offender registry.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes:
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional costs to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant shall have no contact with the victim.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim within 30 days and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall obtain his GED/HSED or high school diploma through the Medford Adult Diploma Program.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

Terminated - regular
DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation
of Motion Hearing on April 24, 2018 - Paula J. Anderson, RPR
to revoke deferred entry of judgment agreement

Defendant Austin J. Altieri in court with attorney Alec Nocco.  Defendant Austin J. Altieri in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tlusty states parties are in agreement to motion to revoke Deferred Entry of Judgment and states agreement has been reached on sentencing and places it on the record.  Atty Nocco states that he is not in agreement for the revocation, but there are grounds for the revocation and in agreement with sentencing.  Victim's mother makes statement to the court.  Atty Tlusty makes statement.  Atty Nocco makes statement.  Court grants motion to revoke Deferred Entry of Judgment and finds DE guilty on Ct. 1.  DE makes statement.  Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 3 years with conditions of: court costs; restitution; 6 months in Taylor County Jail with Huber; complete psychosexual evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommendations; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; enroll in sex offender registry; obtain GED/HSED at discretion of agent. Court asks Court Report to prepare transcript at County expense and directs clerk to forward a copy to the DOC. ba
Motion hearing on April 24, 2018 at 10:30 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Austin J. Altieri in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Nocco requests that he is appearing specially on this case, requests to adjourn motion hearing and requests PTC.  No objection by Atty Tlusty. Pre-trial conference scheduled March 16, 2018 at 8:20 a.m. ba

Taylor County Restitution Claim Form
of SRP
Restitution Summary
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement

Defendant Austin J. Altieri in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim notification has been complied with.  Victim not present.  District attorney amends information to add count 2 - exposing genitals 948.10(1)(b).  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to count 1 - 2nd degree sexual assault and count 2 - exposing genitals.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court makes a finding of guilt to Count 1 and enters a deferred agreement for a period of two years.  Upon successful completion of the agreement the felony charge will be dismissed.    Court finds defendant guilty of count 2 and orders withheld sentence probation for 2 years - court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; restitution; no contact with victim; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; letter of apology due within 30 days of sentencing and preapproved by probation; obtain GED or HSED.  Defendant may apply for expungement of his record.  - rt
-Written
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Austin J. Altieri in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Court questions DE.  DE freely and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court bounds DE over for trial.  Information filed by the state, with further reading waived by the defendant.  A not guilty plea entered on all counts within the information.  Bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 02:15 pm. ba
Waiver of Prelim on June 10, 2016 at 11:30 am.
